His death was officially ruled a suicide, but there were widespread public doubts about the circumstances of his death, leading to the establishment of the Hutton Inquiry.

The Hutton Inquiry concluded that Dr. Kelly had indeed taken his own life and that the principal cause of his death was bleeding from incised wounds to his wrist which he had inflicted on himself. The Inquiry also examined the actions of the government and the BBC but cleared the government of any wrongdoing while criticising the BBC for its reporting on the matter. The Inquiry's findings were met with controversy and criticism from some quarters.
